Title:
Intersection of Chlorella, Muriella and Bracteacoccus:
resurrecting the genus Chromochloris Kol & Chodat (Chlorophyceae,
Chlorophyta)
Keywords:
18S, Bracteacoccus cinnabarinus, cryptic taxa, Muriella
zofingiensis, rbcL
Abstract:
The morphologically poor coccoid green algae are generally
difficult to classify and often have a confused taxonomic history. In
the present study, we demonstrate the close relatedness of two green
coccoid taxa that have undergone multiple taxonomic transfers in the
past and we argue for the distinct character of the lineage they form.
We resurrect the genus Chromochloris and attempt to clarify its
phylogenetic relationships to other chlorophyte genera, especially
Bracteacoccus, Chlorella, Muriella, Pseudomuriella, and Mychonastes. We
synonymize Bracteacoccus minutus with Chomochloris zofingiensis. In
addition, we clarify the identity of three UTEX strains listed as
Bracteacoccus.
